This manual describes version &appversion; of &frplain;.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: &fr; are a set of tools that extend the capabilities of &app;, the GNOME Web Browser.
They provide to Epiphany new functionalities and complete some existing.

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: The Actions extension allows you to create specific actions in the context menu, for images, pages or both.

sect3.title: Create Actions
sect3.para:
To create an action, do the following steps:
Choose Edit Actions to open the Actions manager
Click Add to add a new action
In the window "Add Action",
Enter the Name of the action. The name will be displayed in the context menu
Enter the Description of the action. The Description will be displayed in the statusbar of &app; and in the Action Manager
Enter the Command to execute. this command will be executed and will receive as argument the element on which you'll launch the action. This action can be any program or script available in your path
Tick Pages or Images to choose on which elements the action will appears
Click Add
Click Close to close the Actions Manager

sect3.title: Edit Actions
sect3.para:
To edit an action, follow these steps:
Choose EditActions to open the Actions manager
Select the action to edit
Click Edit
Now edit the action like in

sect3.title: Delete Actions
sect3.para:
To delete an action, do the following:
Choose EditActions to open the Actions manager
Select the action to delete
Click Remove
Click Close to close the Actions Manager

sect2.title: Using Actions
sect2.para: To use a custom action, visit a page, right-click on the element you want to perfmon the action, select in the context menu, the action to do.

figure.title: The &app; context menu with the custom action

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: The Ad Blocker extension permits to block ad banners on a website. It allows to avoid to download them, and so to save time and bandwith.

sect2.title: Using Ad Blocker
sect2.para: To use the Ad Blocker, you just have to enable the extension, it will ignore link to ads when you visit websites, and so, they won't be displayed in web pages.

&app; will however display an icon (see ) to inform you that it blocked ads, at the left-bottom hand corner of the window. If you move the mouse pointer over the icon, it will give you of the number of ads blocked in the page.
The Ad Blocker icon

sect2.title: Extend Ad Blocker
sect2.para: Ad Blocker should block most of the advertisement on the web, but if you find that some banners are not blocked or Ad Blocker is too restrictive, you can tune Ad Blocker extension to match your needs.

Ad Blocker uses Perl regular expressions to match known URLs of ads servers and common words used in URLs of ads. Ad Blocker stores the system-wide rules in the file adblock-patterns located in $PREFIX/share/epiphany-extensions/; one regular expression per line.

sect3.title: Add a deny rule
sect3.para: If you want to block an ad not blocked by the Ad Blocker default rules, you may create a blacklist file, and add rules inside.
&app; looks for the blacklist rules in the file $HOME/.gnome2/epiphany/extensions/data/adblock/blacklist.

sect3.title: Add a permit rule
sect3.para: If you want allow to permit an ad to be displayed or correct a rule of Ad Blocker which is too restrictive you can create a whitelist file, and add rules inside.
&app; looks for whitelist rules in the file $HOME/.gnome2/epiphany/extensions/data/adblock/whitelist.

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: The Auto Reload Tab extension allows you to reload a page in a tab regularly.

sect2.title: Using Auto Reload Tab
sect2.para: Enter the URL of a page you want to read and you know its content change often, then choose ViewAuto Reload to enable auto reload, &app; will refresh each 3 minutes.

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: The Auto Scroll extension allows you to scroll a page in any direction automatically. For instance if you set a slow scroll, you can read a whole web page without touching your mouse.

sect2.title: Using Auto Scroll
sect2.para:
To start to auto scroll on a page,
press and release the middle-mouse button; a target appears, and the cursor of mouse pointer is changed to a hand cursor.
Now, move away the cursor from the target, you should see the page that start to scroll.

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: The Certificates extension gives access to the certificates stored by &app;, in order to view or manage them.

sect3.title: View website certificate
sect3.para: When you browse a secured website, the unlocked padlock which appear on the left of the statusbar becomes a locked padlock. When the Certificates extension is activated, you can click on the padlock, it will displayed the certificate information.

sect3.title: Manage Certificates
sect3.para: Certificates extensions lets you manage the certificates stored by &app; Browser.

To display the Certificate Manager, choose ToolsManage Certificates, it gives access to 4 tabs:
Your Certificates
To import, view, backup and delete your own certificates. Personal Certificates can be used to identify when you browse a sensible site.
Other People's
To import, view, edit and delete certificates from people you know.
Web Sites
To import, view, edit and delete certificates from website you visited.
Authorities
To import, view, edit and delete certificates from authorities. Authorities are organizations which create and validate authenticity of published certificates over the Internet.

sect3.title: Manage Security Devices
sect3.para: Security Devices are used encrypt and decrypt connections and can store certificates and passwords.

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: The Error Viewer extension allows you to view error in web pages, validate web pages and check links.

sect2.title: Using Error Viewer
sect2.para:
The Error Viewer is a small but useful extension for webmaster to check that website (specially yours) conforms to Web standards. This extension comes with 3 functions:
Links Checker
Detects dead links on a site
HTML Code Checker
Checks the validity of the source code.
Error Viewer
Displays various errors of a webpage (like javascript, ...)
To launch Links Checker, choose ToolsCheck Links, the error viewer window will open, and the links verification will start automatically.
To launch HTML Code Checker, choose ToolsCheck HTML, the error viewer window will open, and the HTML code verification will start automatically.
To launch Error Viewer, choose ToolsError Viewer, the error viewer window will open, it will display all the validation errors discovered in the web page.

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: The Favicon Fallback extension allows to retrieve the icon favicon.ico when the favicon is not well declared in webpage.

sect2.title: Using Favicon
sect2.para: Once activated, this extension will retrieve the picture file /favicon.ico on each site you will visit If this file exists. Then &app; will displayed this icon on the left of the location bar.

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: The Gestures allows you to use Mouse Gesture, Mouse gestures provides an easy way to quickly perform actions in &app; by drawing a shape with the mouse.

sect2.title: Using Gestures
sect2.para: To perform a gesture, press the middle button in the browser part of a &app; window, move the mouse in one of the following patterns, and then release the button. The cursor will change while the gesture is being performed.

table.title: List of available default patterns in &fr;

row.entry: Left - Down - Right - Down - Left (Do a S)

sect2.title: Create gestures
sect2.para: The Gestures extension lets you create your own gesture patterns, and so let you extend the set provided by default.

sect3.title: Understand how gesture works
sect3.para: &app; stores the definition of the gestures for all users in the file ephy-gestures.xml located in the directory $PREFIX/share/epiphany-extensions/; this file uses the xml format, and defined the gestures for all the users of the system.

If you open this file, you see a set of markup gesture, and inside them, there is one of several markup sequence and one markup action.
A Gesture Example
<!-- down-left --> <gesture> <sequence>36987</sequence> <sequence>3687</sequence> <action>/menubar/ViewMenu/ViewFullscreenMenu</action> </gesture>

sect3.title: Create new gesture
sect3.para: In this section, we will explain how to create a new gesture. We will decide to print the webpage when we will draw a P with the mouse.
To create your own gestures, first create a file named ephy-gestures.xml in the directory ~/.gnome2/epiphany/ which will store your personal gesture definitions.

Open the newly created file with you favorite editor and add the following content:
<?xml version="1.0"?> <epiphany_gestures version="0.4"> <gesture> <sequence></sequence> <action></action> </gesture> </epiphany_gestures>

sect4.title: Define the gesture movement
sect4.para: To define a new gesture, you need at least one or several sequences and an action to execute.

A sequence is a set of numerical values between 1 and 9 which define the gesture to draw following a phone keypad layout (with "1" placed to the top-left hand corner and the "9" at the bottom-right hand corner).
If we want to draw a P, the key sequence is 74123654, insert this value between the markups "sequence".

sect4.title: Define the action
sect4.para: An action describes the path to a menu or toolbar item in the &app; window. All these paths are defined is the file ephy-gestures.xml located in $PREFIX/epiphany-browser/epiphany-ui.xml

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: Greasemonkey is a powerful extension that allows users to use scripts that make on-the-fly changes to specific web pages. The greasemonkey scripts can do pages modifications or automatically fill forms for instance.

Greasemonkey scripts are javascripts and have a file extension ".user.js". Greasemonkey extension doesn't come with any scripts, you have to find by yourself scripts over the web. A good Greasemonkey scripts repository is the site http://userscripts.org/.
To know more about Greasemonkey, visit the Wikipedia Definition.

sect3.title: Install a Greasemonkey script
sect3.para: To install a Greasemonkey script, first locate a link to a greasemonkey script on a webpage, right-click on the link, and choose Install User Script. &app; will download the script; a messagebox will confirm the script is installed and ready to use.

tip.para: You can manually install Greasemonkey scripts by copying them in $HOME/.gnome2/epiphany/extensions/data/

sect3.title: Remove a Greasemonkey script
sect3.para: &app; doesn't provide a Graphical User interface to delete scripts; to remove a script go to $HOME/.gnome2/epiphany/extensions/data/ , and move the script file in the trash.

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: Java Console extension provides access to the Java-Plugin Console.

sect2.title: Using Java Console
sect2.para: To display the Java Console, choose ToolsJava Console.

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para:
The News Feed Subscription extension allows you to subscribe to a news feed offered by the webpage in your favorite news reader. The supported feed readers software are
Liferea
Straw
Blam

sect2.title: Using News Feed Subscription
sect2.para:
To register this feed:
Choose ToolsNews Feed Subscription, a new window appears with the list of available feeds appears. You can also click on the Feed icon to make appear the window News Feed Subscription.
Choose the feeds you wan to register by ticking the checkbox button in front of each feed. If you right-click on a feed title, you can also copy its URL to paste it in a news aggregator not yet supported.
Click Subscribe to subscribe the feeds.

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: The Page Info extension provides detailled information about the web pages you visit.

sect2.title: Using Page Info
sect2.para:
To access the page information choose ViewPage Information; a new window appears, letting you access to 5 tabs:
General
Provides various information on the page and the website
Media
displays media files (pictures, sounds,...) used on the page.
Links
Provides all the links of the webpage.
Forms
All the forms available in the page are displayed.
Metadata
Displays all the information entered by the webmaster about the site.

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: The Push Scroll extension provides scroll function while the middle mouse button is pressed.

sect2.title: Using Push Scroll
sect2.para: To use Push Scroll, simply press the middle mouse button, and while this time move your mouse in any direction, the page will scroll.

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: Opens an interactive Python console, and allows to modify &app; through Python.

sect2.title: Using Python Console
sect2.para: To display the Python Console, choose ToolsPython Console.

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: The Select Stylesheet extension is an extension that enable to switch between the stylesheets of a website, it enables also to disable stylesheet when you browse a page.

sect2.title: Using Select Stylesheet
sect2.para: To switch the style sheet of the website you visit, choose menu ViewStyle , then choose the style sheet among those available.
If you choose the style sheet none the website will not use any style sheet.

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: The Sidebar extension adds a small window on the left side af the &app; window. Sidebar allows to display website content and can provide quick access to their information.

sect3.title: Display Sidebar
sect3.para: By default, the Sidebar is not displayed; to display the Sidebar, choose menu ViewSidebar.

tip.para: You can also toggle visibility of Sidebar by pressing F9.

sect3.title: Add a Sidebar
sect3.para: To add a Sidebar, activate the Sidebar extension, then click on the link that the website provides to install the sidebar. A window requests to add the document to the Sidebar, click Add a Sidebar, the sidebar document is added to the Sidebar.
You can find a list of websites that provide sidebar on DMOZ.

sect3.title: Switch between Sidebars
sect3.para: When you have subscribed to several sidebars, to switch between them, click in the drop-box and select the Sidebar.

sect3.title: Delete a Sidebar
sect3.para: To delete a Sidebar to which you have added, display the sidebar to delete and click on the trash icon

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: The Smart Bookmarks extension is an extension that enable to look up selected text with a smart bookmark.

sect2.title: Using Smart Bookmarks
sect2.para: To use smart bookmarks, see first the appropriate section to create smart bookmark.
To look up text, select a text in a webpage and right-click, choose lookup and choose with which smart bookmark do the lookup. A web browser will be opened with the result of the lookup.

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: The Tab Groups extension makes the new tabs created just after the actual tab.

sect2.title: Using Tab Groups
sect2.para: Once this extension is enabled, it change the normal behaviour (where the new tabs are created at the last place) to a new one. When you open a new tab it will be created just after the actual tab.

figure.title: A new tab created after the first tab

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: The Tab States extension change the status of the tab label to signal the content has changed.

sect2.title: Using Tab States
sect2.para: Once this extension is enabled, when the content of a page in a tab has changed, the tab label will become bold, so you are notified.

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: The Tabsmenu extension allows to move tabs between &app; windows.

sect2.title: Using Tab States
sect2.para: To use this extension you must open at least 2 &app; windows.
To move a tab to another window, display the tab in its in window, select TabsMove Tab to WindowWindow name. The tab is moved to the selected window.

tip.para: You can also move tabs between window, with the context menu on the tabs.
